instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No boot with trackpad connected
threads.message:
Hi,

I got a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A here which will turn black during booting with the trackpad connected (similar to the <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> issue) but will boot fine without trackpad. If I connect the trackpad after boot, it works without issues. Also shows up as USB device.

In verbose mode the last line before turning black is "Airport Link Up on awdl0". Removed Airport but still same behaviour. Also, AP and BT work without issues.

Any idea?

Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No boot with trackpad connected
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No boot with trackpad connected
threads.message: Nah, it is the usual 3662/3787 issue. Without trackpad the CPU is clocked down so it will not crash. Still no solution as I have no time to spend on this.
